questions.question:
The number of terminal oxygen atoms present in the product $B$ obtained from the following reactions is

$\mathrm{FeCr}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{4}+\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{CO}_{3}+\mathrm{O}_{2} \rightarrow \mathrm{A}+\mathrm{Fe}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}+\mathrm{CO}_{2}$

$\mathrm{A}+\mathbf{H}^{+} \rightarrow \mathbf{B}+\mathbf{H}_{2} \mathbf{O}+\mathbf{N a}^{+}$ JEE Main-29.06.2022, Shift-I
The difference in oxidation state of chromium in chromate and dichromate salts is JEE Main-24.06.2022, Shift-I
questions.solution:
: Dichromate $\rightarrow \stackrel{\mathrm{Cr}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}^{2-}}{ }$

$$
\begin{aligned}
& x \times 2+(-2) \times 7=-2 \\
& x=+6
\end{aligned}
$$

Chromate $\rightarrow \stackrel{\mathrm{y}}{\mathrm{Cr}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{4}^{2-}}$

$$
\begin{aligned}
& y+(-2)(4)=-2 \\
& y-8=-2 \\
& y=+6
\end{aligned}
$$

$\therefore$ Difference in oxidation state $(x-y)=6-6=0$.

questions.question:
Dichromate ion is treated with base, the oxidation number of $\mathrm{Cr}$ in the product formed is


JEE Main 26.02.2021, Shift-I
questions.solution:
:

$$
\mathrm{Cr}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}^{2-}+2 \mathrm{OH}^{-} \square \quad 2 \mathrm{CrO}_{4}^{2-}+\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}
$$

Let, oxidation state of $\mathrm{Cr}$ in chromate ion is $\mathrm{x}$.

$$
\begin{gathered}
\mathrm{CrO}_{4}^{2-} \Rightarrow \mathrm{x}+(-2) 4=-2 \\
\quad \Rightarrow \mathrm{x}=6
\end{gathered}
$$

Hence, the oxidation state of $\mathrm{Cr}$ in $\mathrm{CrO}_{4}^{2-}$ is +6 .

questions.question: The sum of oxidation states of two silver ions in $\left[\mathbf{A g}\left(\mathbf{N H}_{3}\right)_{2}\right]\left[\mathbf{A g}(\mathbf{C N})_{2}\right]$ complex is........... JEE Main- 01.09.2021, Shift-II
questions.solution:
:

$\left[\mathrm{Ag}\left(\mathrm{NH}_{3}\right)_{2}\right]\left[\mathrm{Ag}(\mathrm{CN})_{2}\right]$ complex is dissociates into

$\left[\mathrm{Ag}\left(\mathrm{NH}_{3}\right)_{2}\right]^{+}$and $\left[\mathrm{Ag}(\mathrm{CN})_{2}\right]^{-}$.

$\because \quad\left[\mathrm{Ag}\left(\mathrm{NH}_{3}\right)_{2}\right]$

Let, oxidation state of $\mathrm{Ag}$ is $\mathrm{x}_{1}$.

$\therefore \quad \mathrm{x}_{1}+2(0)=+1$

Or $\quad \mathrm{x}_{1}=+1$

And $\quad\left[\mathrm{Ag}(\mathrm{CN})_{2}\right]^{-}$

Let, oxidation state of $\mathrm{Ag}$ is $\mathrm{x}_{2}$.

$\therefore \quad \mathrm{x}_{2}+2(-1)=-1$

Or $\quad \mathrm{x}_{2}=+1$

$\therefore \quad \mathrm{x}_{1}+\mathrm{x}_{2}=1+1=2$

questions.question:
Dichromate ion is treated with base, the oxidation number of $\mathrm{Cr}$ in the product formed is


JEE Main 26.02.2021, Shift-I
questions.solution:
: $\mathrm{Cr}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}^{2-}+2 \mathrm{OH}^{-} \square \quad 2 \mathrm{CrO}_{4}^{2-}+\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}$

Let, oxidation state of $\mathrm{Cr}$ in $\mathrm{CrO}_{4}^{2-}$ is $\mathrm{x}$

$\therefore \quad \mathrm{x}+4(-2)=-2$

$\mathrm{x}-8=-2$

$\mathrm{x}=+6$

questions.question:
The oxidation states of transition metal atoms in $\mathrm{K}_{2} \mathrm{Cr}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}, \mathrm{KMnO}_{4}$ and $\mathrm{K}_{2} \mathrm{FeO}_{4}$, respectively, are $x, y$ and $z$. The sum of $x, y$ and $z$ is


[JEE Main 2020, 2 Sep Shift-II]

$$
